subject: Programming
title: Heuristics and Approximation
description: A 60-second lesson on Heuristics and Approximation.

hook.text: When perfection is impossible, getting close fast is the next best thing.

buildup.text: Heuristics use rules of thumb to find good-enough solutions in reasonable time.

discovery.text: Approximation algorithms guarantee solutions within a known factor of optimal â€” say, 1.5x.

twist.text: Some heuristics work brilliantly in practice but have no theoretical guarantee at all.

climax.text: Real-world engineering runs on approximation. Bridges, routes, and schedules all accept 'close.'

punchline.text: Good enough, fast enough, wins every time.

quiz.question: What do approximation algorithms guarantee?
options: Solutions within a known factor of optimal
